body:
Is there way to avoid this checking on code? For example casting uintptr or something hack. I don't read code yet but if cgocheck is looking table of pointers managed by go and passing pointer into C, I wonder this panic occur when the value of pointer mached pointer on the table.
```go
var a uintptr
a = 0xDEADBEAF
C.foo(a) // cgocheck panic?
```
